text:
Neena Gupta Explains She Can Never Have The Privilege To Be 'Choosy' Despite Delivering Hit Films
Neena Gupta Explains She Can Never Have The Privilege To Be 'Choosy' Despite Delivering Hit Films
At 62, second innings in life has just begun for actor Neena Gupta. In 2017, Neena had posted a message on Instagram, where she asked people for 'work'.
Cut to 2018. This year, Neena has had back to back hits including Veere Di Wedding, Mulk, and Badhaai Ho. She also features in chef Vikas Khanna's "The Last Color," for which she even attended the Cannes Film Festival earlier this year.
But even with these back to back hits, Neena thinks that she cannot be too choosy when it comes to work, but does the best from what is offered to her. Talking to IANS, Neena said,
Junglee Pictures
Don't Miss 12.5 K SHARES 5.5 K SHARES 3.5 K SHARES 3.1 K SHARES 2.5 K SHARES
"Out of what offers I get, I do only those films which excite me... I am doing 'Panga,' it's a small role, but a nice one. I can't be so choosy. I do the best offers that come my way."
Neena's next is Arjun Kapoor and Parineeti Chopra-starrer commercial drama "Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar."
title: Neena Gupta Explains She Can Never Have The Privilege To Be 'Choosy' Despite Delivering Hit Films
description: The 62-year-old actress has been seen in films like "Veere Di Wedding," "Mulk" and "Badhaai Ho." She also features in chef Vikas Khanna's "The Last Color," for which she even attended the Cannes Film Festival earlier this year. She will next be seen in Arjun Kapoor and Parineeti Chopra-starrer commercial drama "Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar."
